main event: On April 27, 1949, at 0320Z in Camp Hood, Texas, a military observer sighted a large dull violet object heading west. The object's light went on and off at regular intervals and was seen for about 60 seconds. It was observed by two enlisted men in the Army.
interesting points: The object was round and appeared to be large, dull violet, and emitted light at regular intervals.
It was estimated to be about 6 to 7 feet above the ground and was about the size of a 50Â¢ piece when compared to known objects.
No sound, odor, or trail was observed in connection with the object.
No definitive maneuvers were observed except that the object stayed about the same height during maneuvers and disappeared after sight.
The object went through the forks of a tree and there were no weather clouds at the time of sighting.
sighted object: large, dull violet object emitting light at regular intervals
witnesses: Two enlisted men in the Army
